title: Billie Lourd goes for gothic glam and green eyes as Cody Fern flashes his midriff at AHS party
text:
American Horror Story celebrating 100 episodes with an eerie cemetery soiree on Saturday.

And series stars Billie Lourd and Cody Fern went all out for the event, held at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery in Los Angeles.

Billie, 27, decided to kick her look up a notch by wearing a pair of sinister-looking bright green contacts.

Spooky: Billie Lourd and Cody Fern went all out for American Horror Story's 100th episode celebrations, held at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery in Los Angeles on Saturday night

Carrie Fisher's daughter wore a short black leather dress with puffy sleeves and a pleated skirt.

The dress had a high neckline and a corset-inspired waistline.

She wore her long brunette hair down in loose waves as she stared down the camera with her piercing eyes and bright red lipstick.

Cody, 31, went typically edgy with a black and white striped zip-up crop-top, flashing his midriff.

Fright fest: She wore piercing green lenses in her eyes for an added flare of scare

Edgy style: Carrie Fisher's daughter wore a short black leather dress with puffy sleeves and a pleated skirt

He wore high-waisted black slacks, heeled snakeskin boots and a accesorised with rings and earrings.

He added a deft touch of feature-enhancing make-up to the look, accentuating the Gothic vibe.

Along with veterans Sarah Paulson and Emma Roberts, Cody and Billie joined a plethora of stars who turned out for the occasion, from season 1 actors Connie Britton and Dylan McDermott to newcomers Gus Kenworthy and Matthew Morrison.

Sarah, 44, and Emma, 28, posed for snaps together in black ensembles, both sporting a sparkling diamond detailing.

Got the look: Cody, 31, went typically edgy with a black and white striped zip-up crop-top, flashing his midriff

What's so funny? Sarah Paulson and Emma Roberts shared a joke as they giggled between photographs

The pair - who have starred alongside one another in AHS Coven, Apocalypse, Freak Show and Cult - shared a joke as they giggled between photographs.

Emma looked fabulous in a black stain romper with off-the-shoulder puffy sleeves and a giant sequin heart that covered her mid-section.

Sarah looked modest in a black long-sleeve dress with puffy sleeves and her blonde hair slicked back.

Emma is currently starring in season 9, AHS 1984, alongside Billie Lourd, 27, who too wore black, but kicked her look up a notch by wearing a pair of sinister bright green contacts.

Co-stars: The pair have starred alongside one another in AHS Coven, Apocalypse, Freak Show and Cult

Details: The ladies both wore black ensembles with matching sparkling diamond detailing

Other stars rocking gothic glam for the occassion included Angela Bassett, Jamie Brewer, Leslie Grossman, Cheyenne Jackson, Evan Peters, Mena Suvari, Kathy Bates, Angelica Ross, Lily Rabe, Zach Villa and Billy Eichner.

Between them, the attendees covered the stellar ensemble cast of the anthology show, which resets its setting every season with many of the same actors.

The FX horror hit debuted in 2011 to great fanfare and was created by Glee co-creators Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuck.

The first season took place in a haunted 'murder house,' while subsequent seasons revolved around scenarios as diverse as an insane asylum, a coven of witches and a circus sideshow.

Red carpet debut! American Horror Story regular Evan Peters hit the red carpet with Halsey for the first time

Leather look: Angela Bassett attends the Hollywood fathering in an all-leather look for the evening

Costume time! Kathy Bates arrives in costume ahead of the AHS event

Glamorous: Mena Survari looks stunning as she wears a black long dress while working all the cameras

Brr: Angelica Ross showed up as Bring It On's Clover cheerleader

Subtle: Lily Rabe went for a subtle look in a white suit and her long blonde hair parted down the middle

The Jessica Lange-starring first season was the most-viewed new cable series of 2011.

Jessica didn't appear to be in attendance for the event.

Although she left the series full-time after AHS: Freak Show, she appeared in last year's AHS: Apocalypse, reprising her role as the grandmother of the Antichrist, Constance Langdon.

Jessica has remained working closely, however, with series creator Ryan - fronting Feud: Bette & Joan and recent Netflix series The Politician.

Pop of color: Zach Villa attended the AHS event in a bright red suit and matching hair

Sophisticated: Jamie Brewer came to the party in a black and white lace dress and a pair of red high heels

Wow! Leslie Grossman worked the cameras as she showed up in a black and gold ensemble ready for a night of fun

Dashing: Morris Chestnut gave a casual pose in a black leather blazer and lightwash gray jeans

Gorgeous: Connie Britton looked elegant in a black pinstripe dress and black high heels ahead of the night of horror

Details: Matthew Morrison attends looking like a sugar skull and a cream suit

Dark vibes: Alexis Martin wore a black lace get-up from head to toe along with a black cape for the American Horror Story event

Dapper dude: Billy Eichner looked sharp in a navy blazer over an off-white T-shirt for his red carpet stroll

American Horror Story's 100th episode aired earlier this week, as part of the current season's run.

Titled Episode 100, it marked the point in AHS: 1984 where the season shifted in direction.

Up until that point, season 9 had been set at Camp Redwood - a rebooted summer camp, shut down years before after a killer went on the rampage.

Welcome! Cheyenne Jackson shows up in a black fedora and white button up looking happy during his night out

Sporty: British-born American freestyle skier Gus Kenworthy showed off his bare chest beneath a dark blazer

And finally: Dylan McDermott shows off his edgy side in a black leather jacket and jeans

Heading inside: Sarah, Leslie, and Billie all hold hands as they pose together while heading inside to the party

Chatting away: Sarah and Evan chat with Ryan Murphy while inside the party

The first few episodes have seen the camp descend into chaos as killer Benjamin Richter, AKA Mr Jingles, finds his way back there on the eve of reopening.

But Episode 100 saw a twist, as the show flashed forward, teasing what becomes of the counselors who survived the second massacre - and those that didn't.

American Horror Story: 1984 continues this week on FX.
description: Billie Lourd and Cody Fern went all out for American Horror Story's 100th episode celebrations, held at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery in Los Angeles on Saturday night.
